items.title: Watch: The Women's Football Show
items.summary: Analysis and top stories from week 12 of the 2025/26 Women‚Äôs Super League season.

items.title: Rode kaart De Jong en vijf goals in El Cl√°sico: Bar√ßa wint Supercopa w√©√©r
items.summary: Het is Barcelona voor het tweede seizoen op rij gelukt om beslag te leggen op de Spaanse Supercopa. Aan de hand van Raphinha lukte het de Catalanen om Real Madrid te verslaan, waarbij Kylian Mbapp√© in de korte speeltijd die hij kreeg niet het verschil kon maken.

items.title: 'They'd take him back in a heartbeat' - Welbeck haunts Man Utd again
items.summary: Veteran striker Danny Welbeck haunts former club Manchester United again and now calls for an England call-up are only going to rise.

items.title: 'Fragile' Man Utd set for fewest games in season since 1914-15
items.summary: Manchester United will prepare for next Saturday's game with Manchester City with no manager in place to lift their 'fragile' confidence.

items.title: VI Live: Italiaanse topper in Milaan voorlopig in evenwicht
items.summary: Welkom in de VI Live op deze ijskoude zondag 11 januari. Volg hier de ontwikkelingen binnen en buiten de grenzen, met op deze plek onder meer aandacht voor de Eredivisie, de finale van de Super Cup tussen Barcelona en Real Madrid en het FA Cup-toernooi.

items.title: El Cl√°sico leert: Xabi Alonso heeft slechts ruimte voor √©√©n solist
items.summary: Inleiding

items.title: Farioli kiest voor contractverlenging bij koploper FC Porto
items.summary: Francesco Farioli heeft zijn contract bij FC Porto verlengd. De voormalige trainer van Ajax ligt nu tot medio 2028 vast bij de koploper van Portugal.

items.title: Lacey (18) krijgt 'belachelijke' rode kaart tijdens eerste minuten op Old Trafford
items.summary: De rode kaart die Shea Lacey tegen Brighton & Hove Albion kreeg, was volgens Darren Fletcher belachelijk. Het achttienjarige talent kreeg zondag twee keer geel in de FA Cup, en dat tijdens zijn eerste minuten op Old Trafford.

items.title: Man United knocked out of FA Cup
items.summary: Manchester United were eliminated from the FA Cup after a 2-1 third-round defeat to Brighton & Hove Albion on Sunday, with their former player Danny Welbeck among the goals.

items.title: Martinelli hat-trick as Arsenal beat Portsmouth
items.summary: Gabriel Martinelli scored a hat-trick as Arsenal overcame an early scare to thrash Championship strugglers Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

items.title: West Brom appoint former Man Utd coach Ramsay as new boss
items.summary: West Bromwich Albion have appointed former Manchester United first-team coach Eric Ramsay as their new head coach.

items.title: Goals, shocks and fan power on a record-breaking FA Cup weekend
items.summary: If anyone needed convincing that the FA Cup still matters, this season's record-breaking third round provided all the necessary evidence.

items.title: Raskin appears to squirt water at fan in full-time confrontation
items.summary: Nico Raskin appeared to squirt water at an Aberdeen fan at full-time of Rangers' 2-0 win at Pittodrie on Sunday.

items.title: Liverpool's Bradley out for season with knee injury
items.summary: Liverpool defender Conor Bradley is set to miss the rest of the season after suffering a serious knee injury in Thursday's 0-0 draw with Arsenal.

items.title: USMNT's Pepi suffers broken arm scoring for PSV
items.summary: United States striker Ricardo Pepi suffered a broken forearm while in action for PSV Eindhoven on Saturday and and is set to be sidelined for two months, the Dutch club has confirmed..

items.title: MLS players support plan to align calendar
items.summary: Major League Soccer players expressed support over the board of governors' decision to align with the international calendar.

items.title: Danny Welbeck shines as Brighton dump Manchester United out of FA Cup
items.summary: Manchester United‚Äôs hunt for trophies is over inside the second week of January after a ruthless Brighton took advantage of yet another loose defensive performance. This FA Cup third-round knockout means the 13-time winners have been dumped from the competition and the League Cup at the first opportunity for a first time since 1981-82. By the end of May, United‚Äôs season will stand at a total of 40 games ‚Äì their lowest number in a complete campaign since 1914-15. If the Carabao Cup penalty shootout elimination at Grimsby in August was dire, this disappointment was as concerningly insipid. Goals from Brajan Gruda and Danny Welbeck, one in each half, (probably) ended Darren Fletcher‚Äôs record as the interim manager as winless ‚Äì this defeat following the draw at Burnley in the Premier League on Wednesday. Continue reading...

items.title: Problems mount for 'fragile' Man Utd as Brighton book FA Cup fourth-round spot
items.summary: Manchester United's problems continued to build after Brighton secured their place in the FA Cup fourth round with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford.

items.title: 'Big personality' Martinelli goes from 'idiot' to hat-trick hero
items.summary: Gabriel Martinelli was branded an "idiot" a few days ago - but showed great personality to respond with an FA Cup hat-trick, according to Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta.

items.title: Taty Castellanos edges West Ham past QPR in FA Cup to offer respite for Nuno
items.summary: Forget the magic of the FA Cup, for West Ham the reality of what is soon likely to be a Championship fixture ‚Äì an indicator that life in the second tier will be no cakewalk. That QPR took them to extra time will do little for Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo‚Äôs standing, despite a first win since 8 November. There were, though, positives to take in the performance of Taty ¬≠Castellanos, the Argentinian striker who scored the Hammers‚Äô winning goal. Have West Ham at last ended a search for a striker that has lasted almost as long as their London Stadium tenancy? They have looked everywhere. Continue reading...
